Given a positive integer $n$ (1 ≤ $n$ ≤ 10⁶), find the maximum possible value of the "beauty" of a permutation of integers from 0 to $n$.

The beauty of a permutation $p = p_0, p_1, ..., p_n$ is defined as the result of applying the bitwise XOR operation to all pairs of numbers in the permutation. 

Output the maximum beauty and an example permutation that achieves this beauty. If there are multiple permutations with the same maximum beauty, you can output any one of them.
Find the largest possible sum you can get by applying the XOR operation to pairs of numbers in a permutation of numbers from 0 to n. Print the maximum sum and one permutation that achieves it.
